page.title: 04CUSTOMS IN SHEERNESS
page.content: IN SHEERNESS THERE ARE MANY CUSTOMS AND TRADITIONS THAT ARE NOT FOUND ANYWHERE ELSE IN ENGLAND.FOR EXAMPLE,ON{NEW YEAR'S EVE}PEOPLE USED TO CLIMB OUR EDWARDIAN CLOCKTOWER WHICH IS ABOUT 35 FEET TALL,UNTIL THE AUTHORITIES BOXED IN THE CLOCK FACE OVER THE CHRISTMAS SEASON TO PREVENT THIS HAPPENING. IN A HOUSING ESTATE CALLED QUEENSWAY WE PLAY OUR HI-FI'S AND RADIOS AS LOUD AS THEY CAN GO. ALSO OFF SHEERNESS ON{NEW YEARS EVE AT 24.00 THE SHIPS SOUND THEIR HORNS AND PEOPLE GO TO THE SHORE OR COME OUT OF THEIR HOMES TO LISTEN TO THEM. ANOTHER CUSTOM IS THAT IN AUGUST THERE IS A ZULU INVASION.MEN DRESSED UP AS ZULUS INVADE THE BEACHES AND GO ROUND ALL THE PUBS.IN THE AFTERNOON THEY JOIN THE{CARNIVAL}WHICH GOES AROUND THE TOWN COLLECTING FOR CHARITY
